name: Peter Senge
background: American systems scientist (born 1947), senior lecturer at MIT Sloan, founder of Society for Organizational Learning. Author of 'The Fifth Discipline' (1990). Background in aerospace engineering (Stanford BS), social systems modeling (MIT MS), management PhD (MIT). Key focus: learning organizations, systems thinking.

principles.name: Mental Models
principles.description: Deeply ingrained assumptions/generalizations shaping worldview; surface, test, improve them.
principles.falsification: When mental models leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Personal Mastery

principles.falsification: When personal mastery leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Shared Vision

principles.falsification: When shared vision leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Systems Thinking
